title:
Transverse momentum spectra of hadrons produced in central heavy-ion
  collisions

title_detail.value:
Transverse momentum spectra of hadrons produced in central heavy-ion
  collisions

summary:
In-medium effects of transverse-mass distributions of quarks and gluons are
considered assuming a possible local equilibrium for colorless quark objects
like mesons and baryons created in central A+A collisions. It is shown that the
average square of the transverse momentum for these partons grows and then
saturates when the initial energy increases. Within the quark-gluon string
model it leads to the energy dependence of hadron transverse mass spectra which
is similar to that observed in heavy ion collisions. Comparison with other
scenarios is given.

INTRODUCTION

Sear hing for a new physi s in heavy-ion ollisions at AGS, SPS and RHIC energies has
led to intense theoreti al and experimental a tivities in this eld of resear h [1℄. In this
respe t the sear h for signals of a possible transition of hadrons into the QCD predi ted
phase of de onned quarks and gluons, quark-gluon plasma (QGP), is of parti ular interest.
Among many signals of the QGP formation, one of the earliest is based on the relation of
the thermodynami variables, temperature and entropy, to the observable quantities, the
average transverse momentum and multipli ity, respe tively. Shuryak [2, 3℄ and van Hove [4℄
were rst to put forth arguments that the transverse momentum as a fun tion of multipli ity
ree ts general properties of the equation of state of hot and dense matter. In the ase of the
rst order phase transition this relation is quite spe i due to inevitable formation of the
oexisten e phase of quark-gluon plasma and hadrons, the mixed phase (MP). Experimental
dete tion of the QGP phase and the MP in A+A ollisions is a non-trivial task be ause of
smallness of the spa e-time volume of the hot and dense system and possible ontributions
of hadroni pro esses simulating signals of QGP and MP formation. Nevertheless, re ent
experimental study of the transverse-mass spe tra of kaons from entral Au+Au and Pb+Pb
ollisions revealed "anomalous" dependen e on the in ident energy. The ee tive transverse
temperature (the inverse slope-parameter of the transverse mass distribution at the mid-

phase transition and indi ation on the MP [8, 9℄. This assumption on the rst order phase

for ollisions in the AGS domain and its subsequent attening in the low energy SPS regime.
The failure was attributed to a la k of pressure. This additional pressure must be generated

In addition, as was shown in [13℄, these experimental data within the onsidered energy
